comment: Professor Tagliatela is by far my favorite professor at KSU and I have taken 3 of her classes. She is incredible and truly cares about her students learning and personal lives.

Dr. T. structures the class in a very organized manner. Her syllabus is extremely detailed, and you will know what the expectations for the class are at the beginning of the semester. She gives really good feedback on the papers you submit and this class will make you a better writer.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Tough class, but Dr. T is VERY clear in her expectations. No tests, many quizzes that she gives plenty of resources to be successful on. She is so upbeat and easy to talk too. Fairly lenient and will extend some due dates if she needs. U do a 1 research paper thru the semester but it is laid out to the detail and done in segments. honestly love her

I've never used rate my professor, however, I feel like it was strongly needed for me to leave a review about this professor. She tells you that most of her students fail her class the first time, and I think it is sad for a teacher to brag about that. You're going to fail if SHE believes you don't know enough information. NOT SENIOR SAFE ZONE!!!

Dr.T was my favorite professor at KSU! She is super nice but she may come off a little intimidating and I think it is because she just knows so much and the program she when through. If you just want an easy grade don't take her because you will not do well but if you truly want to know the information then for sure take her! lots of assignments

By far the BEST professor I have had at KSU. Had her for learning and behavior, which is supposed to be one of the hardest psych classes, but she made it so enjoyable. Always in a good mood and always willing to answer any questions you have.

I expected it to be hard because it was a four-week summer, 2021 class. However, Professor Lauren provides enough resources for activities that are super helpful if you use them. The only textbook you need is APA 7. She is a very helpful instructor if you put in the work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I am currently taking her class for the 4 week summer session. I am due to graduate in December and I cannot seem to please this woman. I may have to drop her because no matter how hard I work I just cant get a good enough grade. I would stay clear from her if you are trying to graduate. I do not recommend her for online she maybe better in person.

Look, she's nice and funny. But she loads information on you and is extremely technical. She doesn't believe in extra credit. She expects most students to fail her first test. You will probably fail all of them. Doesn't have much common sense. If you're great at getting A's from studying you'll be fine. If you slack at all, avoid her, you'll fail.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: she has harder tests and grades SO HARD on essays and homework. gives partial credit but is very particular and detailed. not too bad of a class though. she breaks down the subject really well and lectures are interesting. I would highly recommend her. she is engaging, interactive, funny, helpful, smart, and knowledgeable

She's energetic, funny, & VERY particular with APA citing!!! No extra credit, tough grader to the max, gives feedback, at times grades took some time to be posted because she has many classes, very consistent with grading, you have to participate, & there's a lot of WORK for this class so stay on top of deadlines!!Great person & professor!!

Dr. Tag is genuinely my favorite professor at KSU. I had a bad time with my Careers in Psych professor but Dr. Tag has restored my faith in my major. Lectures are enthralling, her personality is casual and energetic yet highly knowledgeable. Study guides and PowerPoints online, but you'll understand the material a lot better if you attend class.

This class is difficult and yes you do have to work for your grade. Class was done in 4week summer semester. Multiple choice quizzes, mini presentation, 1 big paper thats broken down into smaller assignments. Shes great on helping you develop it along the way, paper presentation, several assignments here and there. You have to work for it!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Took Dr. Tag for Senior Seminar in a four week hybrid course. She was awesome! She gives great feedback and she's  awesome about grading and returning assignments within a few days. She's very approachable and super helpful. Take her. Glad I did.

Take either research or experimental with her and you're smooth sailing for the rest of your degree. You have to go to class and put in effort, but I learned so much I would take her for another class. Tests, quizzes and a big research paper in each class, but she breaks down the research paper so much so its not so overwhelming.

She's super knowledgeable, and her teaching style is incredibly helpful. For each unit, you will have an ungraded activity, a graded activity, a quiz, and an exam, all of which she will go over and prepare you for. The material is tough, but she genuinely wants you to learn. I have had her twice and TA'd for her and she's the best teacher at KSU.

Her class is not an easy A, but I was happier with a B in her class than any A I've received. Amazing teacher who knows a lot about her subject. Makes class interesting and fun even though it's hard. She is clear with her instructions and very approachable. I cannot recommend this teacher enough. I wish she taught more of my remaining courses

Dr. Taglialatela is awesome. She is spunky and makes learning and behavior a fun class. She is not easy, but she is worth taking. Tests are short answer and multiple choice. Go to class, you will be much better off.
